intro: Macroclinium pachybulbon, commonly known as the thick-rooted climber, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orchidaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its robust, fleshy rhizomes and long, climbing stems with lance-shaped leaves. Its showy, orchid-like flowers are typically yellow or orange with a distinctive lip. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
